version_name: 4.2 - 4.2.1-NEW: Support for iPad!  The app takes advantage of the iPad's gorgeous screen to show you scores and news at the same time.  Your favorite teams follow you throughout the app.  Simply tap the team icons in the lower right for quick access.-NEW

version_description:
[+] Fixes an issue where some fans were not receiving notifications after setting up a new iPhone from an iCloud backup.
[+] Fixes an issue where some fans were getting intermittently logged out of the app.

[+] New Live Streaming Experience
- Stats. Without leaving the stream, see how many 3s Curry has hit -- just tap the Stats button.
- Live Cards. See scores from other games, read articles, and follow commentary alongside your stream.
- Stream Swi

[+] Video Docking: Swipe down on any video you are playing to use the rest of the app while watching.
[+] Chromecast Support: Cast live games of your favorite team and leagues from your iPhone or iPad right to your TV.
[+] Enhanced Golf Leaderboard:

[+] Gesture over to news on the homescreen to see the Headlines collection. You’ll get the top seven stories of the day in a nice, tight package.
[+] Time to play ball. Caribbean Series and the World Baseball Classic are now added to the sports list.

[+] Gesture over to news on the homescreen to see the Headlines collection. You’ll get the top seven stories of the day in a nice, tight package.
[+] Time to play ball. Caribbean Series and the World Baseball Classic are now added to the sports list.

[+] Introducing Homescreen Video. Giving you the best plays of the day, breaking news and your favorite teams videos.
[+] Gesture over to news on the homescreen to see the Headlines collection. You’ll get the top seven stories of the day in a nice, ti

[+] Ready for the NBA Playoffs? Log in with your TV Provider in Settings to get the best of the playoffs streaming live on your homescreen.
[+] Africa – Kwese ESPN edition: Looking for South African Premiership coverage? Switch to the Africa edition to

[+] Channel surf directly from the live video player. Tap “Watch” to see every stream all in one place, and jump between your recent streams.
[+] Bug fixes and optimizations. Faster boot times, smoother scrolling, more stable video player, fewer crashe

[+] Want to watch your favorite teams play? If your team is on ESPN, it’ll be waiting for you when you open the app! All you need to do is log in with your cable provider.
[+] Bug fixes and performance improvements.

[+] Want to watch your favorite teams play? If your team is on ESPN, it’ll be waiting for you when you open the app! All you need to do is log in with your cable provider.
[+] Bug fixes and performance improvements.

[+] Love watching your team play live? With new live stream previews, never miss a minute of the action while you sign in with your cable provider.
[+] There’s a new home for all things video! Our redesigned Watch Tab lets you easily browse your favori

[+] Optimized for iOS 11 and the new iPhone X to have us running as smoothly as Saquon Barkley through the hole
[+] Bug fixes and performance improvements.

[+] Optimized for iOS 11 and the new iPhone X to have us running as smoothly as Saquon Barkley through the hole
[+] Bug fixes and performance improvements.

[+] Don’t have an ESPN account? Now anyone can sign up for alerts to get game updates and highlights faster than Bryce Love turning the corner for a 50 yard TD run.
[+] Bug fixes and performance improvements.

[+] Did your team miss out on a bowl game? Maybe you're a Giants fan? We added support for Rugby to entertain you till next football season, with 23 new leagues to follow.
[+] We’ve also beefed up our support for other sports, so check out our new socc
